title: PDP-19.1: Feeder Pools Deployment (MIP-9)
body:
*Posted by a representative of the mStable protocolDAO*

[This forum post](https://forum.mstable.org/t/mip-9-feeder-pools/410/4) and [this MIP-9](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-9) detail a strategy for deploying Feeder Pools on mStable.

These Feeder Pools (fPools) provide important benefits to mAssets in the following ways:

- Free fAsset → mAsset swaps (effectively allowing users to ‘mint’ mAssets with any fAsset)
- Leveraging the mAsset SAVE rate by providing a source of demand for mAssets from within mStable (thus increasing mAsset SAVE APY)
- Feed swap fees back into the mAsset by supporting trades between fAsset <-> mAsset bAssets

Should the Feeder Pools start to be deployed as outlined in MIP-9?
author: 0x0945b923d4922Bf30528931Ed92f1c20CEac9541

title: MDP18.2: Swiss Association funding - USD
body:
**Posted by a representative of the mStableDAO**

In this forum [post](https://forum.mstable.org/t/mstable-association-genesis-grant-request/380), it was requested that the mStableDAO provide the initial grant to fund a Swiss based “mStable Association” that was recently established. This Association was created to indirectly support the mStable ecosystem, and will form a pillar in mStable's next phase of decentralisation alongside the mStableDAO, ProtocolDAO and grant recipients. 

As stated in the post, the Association will exert no control over the mStable protocol. The association can only deploy funds according to its purpose, which is funding development, continued decentralisation and growth of the mStable protocol. Recipients of these grants will be determined through an open and transparent application process.

Meta Governors voting on this proposal are authorising the grant, but tokens will only move on chain should the mStable Association request them. Should this proposal be approved, the Association has until 31 December 2021 to make the request - beyond this date, the grant approval lapses, and will need to be re-authorised by Meta Governors. Any transfer is dependent on a positive clarification on tax matters (in the form of a respective tax ruling) and regulatory matters (in the form of a no-action letter from FINMA). 

The grant request comes in two parts, one for an allocation of Meta tokens, and another for a USD amount which will come as proceeds from liquidated BAL tokens held by the mStable DAO. This proposal is for the USD amount, and assumes that the total USD value of the BAL tokens held by the DAO at the time will be sufficient to cover the USD amount.

The option that receives the highest vote percentage will be executed by the mStableDAO.

Any discussion should be written in the forum post [here](https://forum.mstable.org/t/mstable-association-genesis-grant-request/380). 

**What amount of USD should be provided to the mStable Association as a grant by the mStableDAO?**
choices: 0 MTA - Do not give the grant
author: 0x4B37BbC8CAb32aade27Ce8b1bb2A9E614de81E03

title: PDP16 / MCCP-3: Increase Save liquidator's weekly USD contribution
body:
**Posted by a representative of the current mStable protocolDAO**

As detailed in this [forum post](https://forum.mstable.org/t/pdp16-increase-save-liquidators-weekly-usd-contribution-mccp-3/370/2), it has been proposed that the maximum USD amount of liquidated COMP, AAVE and other lending platform tokens sent to boost the SAVE APY each week be increased.

The impacts of doing this will bolster the Save APY, and mean that concurrent proposals seeking to channel some of these Save APY flows to destinations other than savers (such as the Buyback and Make 2 proposal) will have a minimal impact on Save yields.

The forum discussion surfaced other alternatives to increasing the liquidation amount, such as allocating some of the COMP to other yield farming or lending opportunities. A further exploration into this has been presented as the final vote option as "alternatives"

As there are more than two choices, the option with the highest weight of votes in support of it will be executed or taken forward for further discussion (even if that option has less than 50% of governor support).

**Should the weekly Save liquidator's weekly USD contribution be increased?**

title: PDP13: mBTC implementation choice
body:
***Posted by a representative of the mStable protocolDAO***

In [MIP-6](https://snapshot.page/[https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-6](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-6)), mStable Head of Research Onur Solmaz outlined the creation of mBTC and an analysis of an upgraded market maker, built to increase composability/optionality for mAssets and reduce gas cost.  MIP-7 is an alternative solution proposed and preferred by the protocolDAO. MIP-7 achieves the goals set out in MIP-6 while enabling several additional features, described in [this forum post](https://forum.mstable.org/t/mip-7-masset-amm-with-feeders/344).

Further discussion is encouraged during the voting period as votes can be changed at any time prior to the vote closing, and voting is free (gasless). Please discuss this on the mStable discord, on the mStable forum and during this MIP's AMA on Tuesday 9 February. 

**Should mBTC launch with MIP-7?**

title: PDP11: MIP-6: mBTC & Upgraded AMM
body:
***Posted by a representative of the mStable protocolDAO***

In [MIP-6]([https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-6](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-6)), mStable Head of Research Onur Solmaz outlined the creation of mBTC and an analysis of an upgraded market maker, built to increase composability/optionality for mAssets and reduce gas cost.

Through a discussion on [mStable's forum]([https://forum.mstable.org/t/mip-6-bitcoin-masset-mbtc-and-new-amm-based-design/277](https://forum.mstable.org/t/mip-6-bitcoin-masset-mbtc-and-new-amm-based-design/277)), certain parameters were discussed. 

The mStable protocolDAO is proposing the creation of a new mAsset, mBTC, which unites various Bitcoin-backed ERC-20 tokens. Mints, redeems and swaps with bAssets are not 1:1, and instead determined by a new AMM-based design allowing for low slippage transactions and higher liquidity.

It is proposed that mBTC be created and deployed with the new AMM. A subsequent vote will be held to determine which underlying tokenised BTC options will be whitelisted as bAssets should this vote pass.

Further discussion is encouraged during the voting period as votes can be changed at any time prior to the vote closing, and voting is free (gasless). 

**Should mBTC with an upgraded AMM be deployed when it is ready?**

title: Lower the cache size to allow sUSD swaps
body:
**From mStable protocolDAO**

A number of users have highlighted an issue with mint/swap/redeem. When trying to swap 'out' sUSD, and you will get an error "Error during estimation execution reverted: There is not enough liquidity available to redeem".

This is due to Aave not having enough available sUSD to withdraw from its lending market: https://app.aave.com/markets.

The mUSD cache keeps a certain proportion of each bAsset in raw form (e.g. sUSD, not on Aave), to make mint/swap/redeem cheaper with that asset. When the cache goes to 0, it tries to reset itself to x% of total supply (in this case $1.6m USD) in raw sUSD by redeeming asUSD (read more [here](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-3)). There is not enough available liquidity to do this at the moment on Aave.

**This is nothing to be concerned about**. AAVE are planning to disable borrowing, so this will mean that loans gradually get repaid and liquidity frees up.

In the short term we propose a significant reduction to the size of our cache size so that most withdrawals are unblocked.

Setting the cache to 2% would free it up and allow it to operate under relatively normal circumstances, keeping between 0-740k USD in the cache at any one time.

Should we set the cache to 2% to free up the basket?
choices: No, keep it as it is
author: 0x0945b923d4922Bf30528931Ed92f1c20CEac9541

title: Add PAX to bAsset after new AMM launches
body:
This proposal asks whether a USD stablecoin, Paxos Standard (`$PAX`), should be added as a whitelisted collateral asset to mUSD's basket after mStable's new Incentivized Constant Sum Market Maker AMM is deployed for mUSD, anticipated to occur in Q1 2020. 

Those for the proposal noted the benefits of including another fiat-currency backed stablecoin, a stablecoin with high liquidity (currently ~475,000,000 as of this writing), opening mStable SWAP to potential increases in swap volume, quick (sub-90 minutes) issuance and redemption, among other arguments.

Those against the proposal noted that PAX is issued by a single firm, Paxos.

You can view and engage with the discussion in the [forum here](https://forum.mstable.org/t/discussion-add-pax-busd-to-mstable-basket/86/).

**Should `$PAX` be added as a whitelisted collateral asset to mUSD's basket after mStable's ICSMM is deployed for mUSD?**

title: Consolidate all unallocated MTA to mStable DAO
body:
**Do you approve of all unallocated MTA currently custodied in the mStable genesis team's various addresses being consolidated into the mStable DAO?**

As part of mStable's ongoing transition to DAO governance over the mStable protocol, the genesis team proposes that all unallocated MTA for public use purposes be consolidated in to the mStable DAO. Tokens would be consolidated in this address under control of the mStable DAO: 

`0xb8541E73Aa47a847fA39E803D19a3f9b1bbc5a6C`

The rationale for this includes:

- Decentralisation of the MTA treasury from genesis team custody to a broader group of stakeholders nominated to be signers on the DAO
- Preparation for automation of EARN rewards and other roadmap items
- Preparation for full on chain governance driven by Meta governors

A [forum thread on this topic](https://forum.mstable.org/t/proposal-consolidate-unallocated-mta-in-mstable-genesis-teams-various-addresses-to-mstable-dao/317) did not elicit any negative feedback. 

**Should all unallocated MTA currently custodied in the mStable genesis team's various addresses be consolidated into the mStable DAO?**

title: Should mStable fund an educational campaign?
body:
It has been proposed to conduct an educational campaign covering the basic actions users can perform on mStable's apps. This campaign will be conducted on a platform called [RabbitHole](https://rabbithole.gg/) to help bring new users to mStable by educating them on the fundamentals of how mStable works. 

In exchange for verifiably performing certain operations on the mStable apps, users will be rewarded MTA. 

From discussion in the forum, it has been suggested that a good first pilot campaign could be minting mUSD and then contribute it to SAVE. Due to gas costs of performing such a transaction, the genesis team proposes that it sets a lower bound of 100 mUSD as the minimum mint and save deposit amount to qualify. This campaign would be run in Q1 2021, with a total of 5000 MTA as the total rewards pool.

More details and the discussion regarding this proposal can be found here in [this forum post](https://forum.mstable.org/t/active-signal-mta-campaign-on-rabbithole-to-bring-in-more-users-token-holders/274).

There will be a $2,000 fee paid by the genesis team to setup the campaign.

**Should 5,000 MTA be allocated to a pilot RabbitHole educational campaign in 2021?**
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: imUSD Deposit Box - length of lockup and vesting schedule
body:
*Please only vote on this proposal if you voted YES to amending mStable's SAVE functionality as outlined in MIP-5.*

In order to improve long-term alignment with the future of mStable's protocol, mStable's genesis team has proposed an `imUSD` deposit box where long-term Savers can store their `imUSD` and earn MTA.

This deposit box serves the following functions:

- supporting the migration of funds
- ensuring that recipients of system yield have a say in how it is distributed
- ensuring long term alignment between mUSD savers and the mStable ecosystem

SAVE's APY will be boosted for MTA Stakers and lockups will apply. 

mStable's genesis team proposes that 20% of MTA earned by Savers be available immediately, and that the other 80% be locked for a period of time.

The genesis team also proposes that the 80% of MTA earned be locked for a period of 6 months, at which point Savers can claim and withdraw them.

Arguments in favour of this lockup mechanism include better long term alignment, along with encouraging participation in staking and mStable's governance. There has also been a clear consensus amongst the community to emit fewer MTA. The lockup period would accomplish this temporarily, along with the measures proposed in other polls. 

What percentage of MTA for Savers should be unlocked immediately, and how long do you think the lock up period should be?

1. Assign the 20/80 split and 6 month lockup outlined by the genesis team in this proposal.
2. Assign unlock/lock percentages and periods, but in some other way different to the core team's suggestion. This will require more proposals in future to specify how it should be done.
3. Do not assign any lock up percentage or period.
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: imUSD Deposit Box - where does the MTA come from and how much should be allocated?
body:
*Please only vote on this proposal if you voted YES to amending mStable's SAVE functionality as outlined in [MIP-5](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-5).*

In order to allocate MTA rewards to the new SAVE `imUSD` Deposit Box, these tokens will need to be sourced either from existing EARN pool emissions or added in as extra MTA emissions. mStable's genesis team have seen a clear and strong consensus from the community that they feel a **reduction in MTA emissions is in the best interests of the project.** There has also been clear consensus that existing EARN pools and their MTA allocations need to be revisited to ensure that they are incentivising long-term and highly aligned contributions or other benefits to mStable.

Given this information, the genesis team proposes the gradual winding down of the USDC 50/mUSD 50 EARN pool, re-allocating a portion of these MTA to the `imUSD` Deposit box. The specifics are outlined below:

- Begin to wind down and re-allocate MTA from the USDC/mUSD pool, in equal portions over a 4 week period.
- Allocate a portion of these MTA towards the Deposit Box over a 4 week period, increasing the weekly amount by 3000 MTA per week to a final weekly allocation of 12,000 MTA
- Excess MTA will be removed from EARN emissions or used elsewhere subject to governance approval (such as an educational campaign on RabbitHole).

**How do you think MTA should be allocated to the new `imUSD` Deposit Box?**

1. Allocate MTA in the manner outlined by the team in this proposal.
2. Allocate MTA to the imUSD Deposit Box, but in some other way different to the team's suggestion. This will require more proposals in future to specify how it should be done.
3. Do not allocate MTA to the imUSD Deposit Box
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: Should SAVE be made composable?
body:
It is proposed that mStable's SAVE functionality be amended to make it more composable. These improvements are detailed in [MIP-5](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-5), and grouped across three broad categories:

1. Tokenising the “Savings Credit”, creating an `imUSD` token that represents the yield accruing `mUSD` and can be transferred and used as collateral in DeFi platforms
    - Core behaviour will be optimised in terms of gas usage
2. Enhancing capital efficiency by depositing `X%` of SAVE deposits elsewhere in the DeFi ecosystem (initially a yEarn `mUSD` vault)
3. Providing an `imUSD` deposit box, a place where long term savers can store their `imUSD` and earn `MTA`
    - This is aimed at supporting the migration of funds, and ensuring that recipients of system yield have a say in how it is distributed
    - To ensure long term alignment, earnings will be boosted for `MTA` stakers, and lockups will apply

Arguments in favour of making it composable include enhancing its functionality, improving capital efficiency for depositors and increasing SAVE’s potential to be integrated across the DeFi and CeFi ecosystems.

All other functionality of the existing platform would remain the same – savers would be required to deposit mUSD into SAVE to mint the composable token and mUSD and the composable SAVE would remain separate tokens/assets.

Note the implementation of this change would require the existing SAVE contract to be closed and, over time, existing savers would migrate their deposits to the new, composable SAVE contract.

MIP-5 can be accessed here - [https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-5](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-5)

**Should mStable's SAVE functionality be amended as outlined in MIP-5?**
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: Should DAI be temporarily removed from the mUSD basket?
body:
It is proposed to temporarily remove DAI from the mUSD basket of assets until the mUSD AMM is upgraded to support assets that remain persistently over peg such as DAI. Should circumstances change where DAI returns to peg before the new AMM is implemented, early re-inclusion may be considered.

Arguments in favour of temporarily removing DAI state that with mStable's current AMM, DAI provides little value as a bAsset since it has remained at 0% basket weight for almost the entire time mUSD has been live. 

Additionally, this bAsset causes gas cost increases of roughly 10-20k Gwei per transaction, 300k Gwei on proportional redemptions, and 20k Gwei on SAVE contract deposits, even whilst it is at 0% weight.

There have not been any arguments against the proposal at this time.

Should DAI be temporarily removed from the mUSD basket?
choices: 1. Yes, temporarily remove DAI from the mUSD basket
2. No, do not temporarily remove DAI from the mUSD basket
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: Where should the 5 MTA/95 mUSD EARN pool rewards be re-allocated to?
body:
*Please only vote on this proposal if you voted YES to retire the 5 MTA/95 mUSD EARN pool in the previous governance cycle.*

The previous polls on this subject asked whether the 15,000 MTA per week rewards currently allocated to the 5 MTA/ 95 mUSD EARN pool should be removed from reward emissions or allocated to other EARN pools. MTA Governors voted in favour of re-allocating these rewards to existing EARN pools, and winding down the 5 MTA/ 95 mUSD EARN pool gradually over a period of 4 weeks. 

In discussions in Discord, Telegram and mStable's forum, feedback on what this re-allocation should be was sought. Three options were proposed:

1. Re-allocate all 15K MTA to the existing 50 ETH/50 MTA Uniswap pool
2. Re-allocate all 15K MTA to the existing ETH/mUSD Uniswap pool
3. Distribute the 15K MTA equally amongst existing EARN pools

Arguments in favour of re-allocating the MTA to the existing 50 ETH/50 MTA EARN pool noted that this pool's liquidity is not competitive with others, potentially resulting in higher slippage.

Arguments in favour of re-allocating the MTA to the 50 ETH/50 mUSD Uniswap pool noted that Uniswap has 9x more total value locked and 16x more trading volume than Balancer, along with being a way to promote mAssets.

Finally, there were no arguments in favour of equally redistributing the MTA to existing EARN pools, only a statement made with some support from the community.

Of the options proposed, the option with the highest vote weight will be selected and implemented, even if it is below a majority (50%) in favour.

If you are in favour of reallocating the 5 MTA/95 mUSD EARN pool's rewards over a 4 week period, where should the 15,000 MTA weekly rewards be sent?
choices: 1. Reallocate rewards to the 50 ETH/50 MTA Uniswap pool
2. Reallocate rewards to the 50 ETH/50 mUSD Uniswap pool
3. Reallocate rewards equally amongst all existing EARN pools
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: Where should the MTA rewards from the 5 MTA/ 95 mUSD EARN pool be allocated?
body:

Amongst the community, two alternatives were proposed as to where the 15,000 MTA per week rewards from the 5 MTA/ 95 mUSD EARN pool should be sent.

Arguments in favour of re-allocating the MTA to other EARN pools noted that some pools are subject to a higher amount of impermanent loss than others. 

Arguments in favour of not re-allocating the rewards, and simply removing them from emission, noted that other EARN pools are already sufficiently rewarded. 

If MTA Governors choose not to re-allocate the MTA, they will be removed from weekly Public rewards emission. 

If MTA Governors choose to re-allocate the MTA to existing EARN pools, a subsequent proposal will be created to determine specifically where these rewards will go.

*If you are in favour of retiring the 5 MTA/95 mUSD EARN pool*, what should be done with the 15,000 MTA weekly rewards?
choices: They should be re-allocated to existing EARN pools

title: Should the 5 MTA/95 mUSD EARN pool be retired?
body:
The mStable community have sent strong signals that the 5 MTA/95 mUSD EARN pool should be retired.

Those in support of this proposal noted that there now exists an imbalance after the the 95 MTA/5 mUSD EARN pool was retired, that this imbalance could be impacting MTA's liquidity, and that Staking v1 now exists for those who want to earn MTA with low possibility of impermanent loss.

title: Should the lending market interest be batched to reduce gas costs?
body:
See forum [thread here](https://forum.mstable.org/t/mip-4-batch-yield-collection-to-reduce-save-gas-costs/230).

**Summary**

Currently the yield produced from lending markets Compound/Aave is collected upon each deposit into SAVE. This is an expensive operation and is performed more frequently than is necessary. This proposal provides a more passive method of collecting the yield, reducing SAVE deposit gas costs by >= 50% while delivering a smoother result.

This upgrade could be bundled nicely with [MIP-3](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-3)

**Proposal**

There are 2 primary sources of income for mAssets - SWAP fees, and lending market income. This MIP will make 2 fundamental changes to the way system income is collected and distributed. The first of which is how the SWAP fees are tracked over time, and the second of which is the frequency of lending market interest is collected. The lending market interest will be collected intermittently and streamed second by second to SAVE.

Should the lending market interest be batched to reduce gas costs?
choices: Yes, batch collections as detailed in MIP-4
No, do not batch collections as detailed in MIP-4
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: Should a cache be added to mUSD?
body:
See forum [thread here](https://forum.mstable.org/t/mip-3-add-cache-to-reduce-gas-costs/227).

**Summary**

Depositing and withdrawing from lending markets (Compound, Aave) constitutes 70-90% of the gas cost of a given transaction. This MIP proposes to implement a cache to reduce frequency of interactions with the lending pools, thus reducing gas costs in MINT, SWAP and REDEEM by 70-90% for the majority of users.

**Proposal**

mStable proposes upgrading the `Masset.sol` contract, allowing it to track and retain a percentage of all collateral in it’s “cache”. Only if necessary will the `Masset` then deposit or withdraw from the lending markets. When a deposit or withdrawal happens, the cache will reset to the ideal target weight, determined by a governance parameter. Subsequently, the `BasketManager.sol` will be upgraded to use the cache data during normal interest collection.

**Subsequent votes**

A subsequent vote closer to release will decide which percentage of total supply will be held in the cache at any one time.

Should this cache be added at this time?
choices: Yes, add the cache as detailed in MIP-3
No, do not add the cache as detailed in MIP-3
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: If the Liquidator is deployed, how much USD worth of value should be liquidated and contributed to the SAVE APY each week?
body:
*Please only vote on this proposal if you voted YES to deploy the Liquidator to bolster the SAVE APY.*

This poll follows on from the previous proposal, and is seeking feedback from the community about the USD amount that should be contributed weekly to bolster the SAVE APY.

### Details

Currently there are 623.34 COMP (worth ~$65,500 USD) tokens able to be liquidated. mStable currently offers SAVE depositors a highly competitive APY through an easy-to-use product. mStable feels the `COMP`, `AAVE/LEND` tokens and other tokens earned by lending assets on these platforms ought to flow back to SAVE depositors.

It is proposed that the `COMP` be liquidated and distributed to depositors on a weekly cadence. 

If you voted in favour of deploying the Liquidator, what US Dollar value worth of tokens should be liquidated each week?

This poll has four choices. Whichever option gets the highest absolute vote percentage will be executed, even if its value is under 50% (i.e. a non-majority).
choices: Liquidate 2,500 USD worth of tokens per week
Liquidate 5,000 USD worth of tokens per week
Liquidate 10,000 USD worth of tokens per week
Liquidate some other USD value of tokens per week

title: Should the Liquidator as detailed in MIP #2 be deployed?
body:
*This poll proposes that a new liquidator, which will liquidate COMP, AAVE/LEND and other tokens earned lending assets on various DeFi platforms, be deployed. The code for this has been prepared by the mStable team and is ready to go.*

This liquidator would automatically sell the tokens earned from the lending markets for mUSD, bolstering the SAVE APY. [mStable Improvement Proposal #2](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-2) (MIP) proposes a liquidation mechanism for assets owned by the protocol.

Liquidations are triggered once by week by any community member through an external function.

**Flow**

1. Liquidator sells `COMP` for `USDC` (or other) on Uniswap once per week (up to `trancheAmount`).
2. Sell `USDC` for `mUSD` on Curve and send to SavingsManager
3. SavingsManager **streams** `mUSD` to SAVE, second by second over the course of a week

## Details

Liquidator has been deployed and the upgrade for 3 affected contracts is now pending a Governance poll.

**Proposed upgrades**:
- Addition of a Liquidator module to sell `COMP` (or `LEND`) for `mUSD` (first on Uniswap, then on Curve)
- Upgrade `CompoundIntegration` to allow liquidation of `COMP`
- Upgrade `SavingsManager` to allow `mUSD` proceeds to be streamed to SAVE

**MIP**: [https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-2](https://mips.mstable.org/MIPS/mip-2)

**Code**: [https://github.com/mstable/mStable-contracts/pull/113](https://github.com/mstable/mStable-contracts/pull/113)

[https://etherscan.io/address/0xb7c77da6e0a8b4f63384fce953327af59c0d5b9d](https://etherscan.io/address/0xb7c77da6e0a8b4f63384fce953327af59c0d5b9d)

title: Where should the MTA rewards for the mUSD/3pool Metapool come from?
body:
*Please only vote on this proposal if you voted YES to allocate 10K MTA to the Curve mUSD/3pool Metapool.*

In Discord, Telegram and mStable forum discussions, two viable sources for where MTA rewards for Curve's mUSD/3pool Metapool were identified:

- Reallocating 10K from the MTA/mUSD 5/95 EARN pool to Curve mUSD/3pool
- Allocate a new 10K from public rewards allocation

A poll on this topic was recently held but ambiguity and concern over where the MTA would be allocated from lead to some confusion and several community members asked for those items to be clarified and brought to another vote.

Arguments in favour of re-allocating existing rewards were raised in an effort to combat further MTA dilution, and noted that there were some existing EARN pools that may be over funded or not providing sufficient utility. 

Arguments in favour of allocating fresh MTA from the public rewards allocation noted that MTA incentives naturally lead to mUSD growth and that liquidity should be contributed to all leading DeFi AMMs to ensure all bases are covered.

General arguments in favour of allocating MTA to this Metapool noted that Curve's AMM is far more efficient than Balancer's for stablecoins, and a single pool would offer trades with three other USD pegged stablecoins. 

As of the creation of this poll, there is currently over $1M of liquidity in this Metapool.

**If you voted in favour of allocating 10K MTA to Curve's mUSD/3pool Metapool, where should the MTA come from?**
choices: Allocate fresh MTA from public rewards allocation
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: Should 10K MTA be allocated to Curve's mUSD/3pool Metapool?
body:
A poll on this topic was recently held but ambiguity in the previous iteration lead to some confusion and several community members asked for those items to be clarified and brought to another vote. In short, in the previous vote for MTA rewards in Curve's mUSD Metapool, more than 50% of votes favoured some rewards while almost 50% favoured 0 rewards. 

**Context** - Curve Finance has added an mUSD/3pool Meta Pool to their platform that sees equal parts mUSD and 3pool [USDT, USDC, and DAI] deposited with CRV rewards for liquidity providers, which launched 14 October 2020 after a positive Curve DAO vote. This pool is incentivised with CRV through the LiquidityGauge (currently offering ~20% APY).

This pool will act as a major source of trading volume for mUSD given that it benefits from [StableSwap](https://www.curve.fi/stableswap-paper.pdf) [PDF] design and the existing liquidity in the 3pool.

While the popular vote of the previous poll (50.4%) was in favour of assigning rewards, this was diluted due to having multiple 'yes' options while the main concerns from 'no' voters being further dilution of MTA, with some confusion over where the MTA would be allocated from. An ideal voting process would have first been a yes/no, followed by a proposal on where (if anywhere) this allocation should come from, and in what quantity.

After discussions in mStable's Discord server, Telegram group and forum, it is proposed to add 10,000 MTA to Curve's mUSD/3pool Metapool. 

A second, separate poll is available for those who agree with this proposal to determine from where the 10,000 MTA is derived.

**Should 10K MTA be allocated to Curve's mUSD/3pool Metapool?**
choices: Yes, allocate 10K MTA to the pool
No, do not allocate 10K MTA to the pool

title: When should sUSD be added?
body:
*Please only vote on this proposal if you voted YES to add sUSD to the mUSD basket.*

For many months, sUSD has consistently remained above its US$1 peg. At time of writing, it is at $1.03.

No economically rational actor would mint mUSD with it, given mUSD's 1:1 nature. Additionally, it was argued that should any sUSD be deposited, that sUSD would be immediately traded out by arbitrageurs. The lack of DAI representation - itself over-peg - was used as evidence of this dynamic. 

This concern was discussed in the forum thread about adding sUSD to the mUSD basket. See (https://forum.mstable.org/t/vote-add-susd-to-musd-basket/45).

If you approve of adding sUSD to the mUSD basket, at what point do you think it would be best to add it?

- **When technically feasible** = as soon as there is developer capacity, the asset will be added. 

- **When sUSD stabilises around its US$1 peg** = 1-2 weeks at its US$1 peg.
choices: When sUSD stabilises around its US$1 peg
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4

title: Should sUSD be added to the mUSD basket?
body:
This proposal asks whether a USD stablecoin, Synthetix's "sUSD", should be added as a whitelisted collateral asset to mUSD's basket.   

Those for the proposal noted the benefits of including another decentralised stablecoin beyond DAI, opening mStable to the Synthetix community and potential increases in swap volume, among other arguments. 

Those against the proposal noted that sUSD has consistently remained above peg, meaning no economically rational actor would mint with it, given mUSD's 1:1 nature. Additionally, it was argued that should any sUSD be deposited, that sUSD would be immediately traded out by arbitrageurs. The lack of DAI representation - itself over-peg - was used as evidence of this dynamic. 

View the discussion in the forum here: (https://forum.mstable.org/t/vote-add-susd-to-musd-basket/45).
author: 0xD43a25B442E2C343dAd472A871c5262cCA275Eb4
